question: Hoffman Enterprises has introduced a new product to the market that has undergone only marginal changes and doesn’t alter consumer use habits. What type of product has Hoffman Enterprises introduced?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Dynamically continuous innovations are fundamentally different from other products on the market, so they require a change in consumer habits.
That’s not correct. Intermittent innovation isn’t a type of newness.
That’s not correct. Discontinuous innovations are new-to-the-world products that are so different from existing products on the market that they create an entirely new market.
With continuous innovation, the existing product undergoes only marginal changes and doesn’t alter consumer habits.

detailedSolution: With continuous innovation, the existing product undergoes only marginal changes and doesn’t alter consumer habits.
